about_the_game:
The Chessie System was created in 1973 to integrate the operations of three of America’s great eastern railroads – the Chesapeake & Ohio, Baltimore & Ohio, and Western Maryland Railway. With the new Chessie System came the railroad’s vibrant and now iconic livery featuring the silhouette of C&O’s famed “Chessie the Kitten” and brilliant yellow, vermillion, and blue colors. And now, you can experience the classic and captivating era of the famed Chessie System as authentically re-created for the popular Train Simulator CSX Hanover Subdivision route!

The Chessie System Retro Pack, developed by High Iron Simulations, includes everything you need to step back in time to the 1970s and early 1980s and go to work for the famed railroad that was a key predecessor of today’s giant CSX Transportation.

The Chessie System Retro Pack includes three types of Electro-Motive diesel locomotives – the GP9 and GP35 road-switcher, as well as the “SW-series” switcher, the latter in three model variations (SW7, SW9, and SW1200). And the pack also includes Chessie System’s ex-Western Maryland C-13A caboose in six liveries, and eight era-authentic types of freight equipment!

All locomotive types are provided in Chessie System’s dramatic full livery and with B&O, C&O, and WM sub-lettering as appropriate. The EMD GP9 is also included in a "patched” C&O/WM blue livery. The steel C-13A cupola caboose is featured in Chessie System, Western Maryland, and four special Chessie “safety” schemes. The freight equipment wears a variety of Chessie System, Western Maryland, Baltimore & Ohio, Chesapeake & Ohio, and generic liveries.

Created to bring the Chessie System era to full life on the highly acclaimed CSX Hanover Subdivision route (which became part of the Chessie System along with the rest of the Western Maryland in 1973) the retro pack includes a selection of nine realistic career scenarios based on actual operations and train symbols.

Note: The locomotives and freight equipment included in the Chessie System Retro Pack can be realistically used on a variety of Train Simulator route; use of the included scenarios requires the CSX Hanover Subdivision route (route available separately).

Take the throttle of the Chessie System’s magnificent and diverse motive power and enjoy classic railroading amid the historic farmlands and scenic mountains of Maryland and Pennsylvania – with the Chessie System Retro Pack for Train Simulator!

Included Scenarios


Nine realistic and challenging career scenarios appropriate to the Chessie System era are included, putting you at the throttle of diverse motive power for mainline, local, and switching operations on the Train Simulator CSX Hanover Subdivision route:

  • [CSR 1.01] Chessie Comes to Hagerstown
  • [CSR 1.02] Chessie Symbol WM-6
  • [CSR 1.03] Working Westward
  • [CSR 1.04] Gathering the Granules
  • [CSR 1.05] Hanover Visitor
  • [CSR 1.06] Something Borrowed, Something Blue
  • [CSR 1.07] Chessie Symbol BH-1, Part 1
  • [CSR 1.08] Chessie Symbol BH-1, Part 2
  • [CSR 1.09] Bittinger Afternoon Call

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Electro-Motive GP9 in Chessie scheme and "patched” C&O/WM livery
  • Electro-Motive GP35 in Chessie scheme and with appropriate WM, B&O, and C&O sub-lettering
  • Electro-Motive SW7, SW9, and SW1200 switchers in Chessie scheme with appropriate B&O and C&O sub-lettering
  • Western Maryland-style C-13A caboose in Chessie, Western Maryland, and four special Chessie "safety" schemes
  • Eight types of freight rolling stock in multiple liveries including Chessie System, B&O, C&O, and Western Maryland
  • Nine realistic career scenarios for the CSX Hanover Subdivision route
  • Quick Drive compatible
  • Download size: 239.5mb

  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
